title: 106_hr2308
content: The Act titled the "New Millennium Classrooms Act" expands the deduction for computer donations to schools and public libraries. Expansion of Computer Donations to Public Libraries by amending the Internal Revenue Code to allow for qualified computer contributions instead of just educational contributions. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to allow for qualified computer contributions to public libraries, expanding on the previous provision for educational contributions. This includes defining a public library as established and maintained by a specific entity, and extending the age of eligible computers for donation. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to extend the time period for qualified elementary or secondary educational contributions from 2 years to 3 years. The amendment also specifies the conditions under which the taxpayer can claim the contribution date. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to extend the time period for qualified elementary or secondary educational contributions from 2 years to 3 years. The taxpayer can claim the contribution date under specified conditions. Reacquired property by the taxpayer is eligible for donation, with amendments applying to contributions made in taxable years ending after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 45D. CREDIT FOR COMPUTER DONATIONS TO SCHOOLS AND PUBLIC LIBRARIES. This section adds a credit for computer donations to schools and public libraries under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The school and public library computer donation credit is 30% of qualified contributions, with a 50% rate for donations to organizations in designated zones or Indian reservations. No credit for computer contributions if the software is included. The New Millennium Classrooms Act provides a tax credit for qualified computer contributions. The credit is 30% of contributions, with a higher rate for donations in designated zones or Indian reservations. No credit is given if the software is not lawfully installed. The credit does not apply to taxable years starting three years after the Act's enactment. Additionally, the current year business credit calculation under Section 38(b) of the Code is amended to include these provisions. The New Millennium Classrooms Act provides a tax credit for qualified computer contributions, with a higher rate for donations in designated zones or Indian reservations. No deduction is allowed for the portion of contributions equal to the credit determined under section 45D(a). The subsections of the New Millennium Classrooms Act are amended to limit the carryback of school and public library computer donation credits before a specified date. The rules for applying this limitation are similar to those for other trades or businesses under common control. The New Millennium Classrooms Act limits the carryback of computer donation credits to schools and public libraries. The amendments apply to contributions made after the enactment date of the Act.
